Posts.EditableText: If I click on a statement or conditional in a Script Edit box, it highlights... if I click again, it erases (why?)... if I click again, I get Script Command Error (or something like that) 380, which shuts down QDK and all unsaved code is raped from my program.  ASL rape should be illegal because it's already immoral.  Is there a way to say, "380: Hey, somewhere there's this error, either the programmer's fault or QDK's, but it isn't that bad, how about if I erase your last command and we'll call it even"?
